title: The Riverdale, (southeast corner of Riverside Drive and 79th Street).
The Riverdale. Southeast Corner of Riverside Drive and Seventy-ninth Street.

text:
Riverside Park, foot of 79th Street, west of Riverside Drive. This shows a view of the Hudson River with a sailing ship called the "Buccaneer."

An earlier view showing the coal pocket at the rivers edge as seen in a northward direction.

View 1: June 16, 1928
View 2: April 14, 1924

P. L. Sperr
title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 79th Street (West).

title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 79th Street (West).

text:
Riverside Park: A series of 3 views showing foot of West 79th Street as viewed from a point to the south of same.

NO. 1 shows the sailing vessels "The Buccaneer" and "The Constitution", the New York Central Railroad tracks and the excavation work for the West Side Improvement Project. NEG # 3456

NO's 2 and 3 show mainly the Railroad tracks and the 79th Street crossing. In the last two the U. S. Navy is on display, an annual event.

View 1: September 8, 1931
View 2: September 29, 1932
View 3: June 11, 1934

P. L. Sperr
title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 79th Street (West).

title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 79th Street (West).

text:
(1 & 2)

Riverside Park: A set of 2 views at 79th Street, showing the tracks of the New York Central Railroad that are between the Drive (buildings thereon) and the North River. These will be covered over and the marginal lands landscaped under a joint project of the Park Department and the Railroad Company which will be completed and opened to the public in late 1937.

July 11, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)

The same area, photographer being at about 75th Street and showing the tracks entering the yards below 72nd Street. Note the buildings on the latter street which form an ell at the southern extremity of the Drive.

July 11, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

view 1 - Neg.# 1782
view 2 view 3

title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 79th Street (West).

text:
Riverside Park: A northward view of same and its environs from a point over West 79th Street, showing this area prior to the radical changes that are planned, by what is known as the West Side Improvement Project. The white line appearing on the left indicates the new shore line. Through the center runs the serpentine like tracks of the New York Central Railroad. Forming the eastern boundary of this marginal area is Riverside Drive. Compare this with a September 15, 1937 photograph (north from 72nd Street), both of which were published by the Park Department on October 12, 1937 in a brochure titled "The West Side Improvement Project."

Fall 1934.

Gift of Department of Parks.
title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 79th Street (West) - [Aerial view.]

text:
Riverside Park, at the foot of West 79th Street, showing the information board locating the various U. S. vessels during their visit to New York City.

P. L. Sperr

June 17, 1934
title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 79th Street (West).

text:
Riverside Park, at West 79th Street, and showing a causeway at that point that carries automotive traffic northward from the West Side Elevated Highway to the Henry Hudson Parkway. Underneath this structure are the tracks of the New York Central Railroad; they having been enclosed and the marginal lands landscaped under joint auspices of the Railroad Company and the Park Department in the West Side Improvement Project. Photographer is viewing southwestward towards the North (Hudson) River, which is on the far side of same.

*January 28, 1938.

George D. Chinn.
title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 79th Street (West).
